alert.note: Alert for Haakon (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 09 at 2:44PM MST until November 10 at 11:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Winter Storm Tonight into Thursday... .Areas of freezing drizzle continue this afternoon to the east of the Black Hills. A winter storm will then quickly move from the Rockies into the northern Plains tonight through Thursday. It will spread a swath of precipitation into northeastern Wyoming and western South Dakota. Mostly snow is expected over northeastern Wyoming, the Black Hills, and into northwestern South Dakota. Some freezing rain and drizzle will occur east of the Black Hills this evening, especially across central South Dakota, but will eventually change to snow later tonight. Gusty northerly winds will develop late tonight into Thursday which will create areas of blowing snow and greatly reduced visibilities where accumulating snow falls. Monitor NOAA Weather Radio for the latest information, forecasts, and warnings. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM MST UNTIL 11 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the winter weather advisory, areas of light freezing drizzle through late afternoon. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations to around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Haakon County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM MST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Warning, 4 PM MST until 11 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice will make travel very hazardous or impossible. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
